thread.title: Top 10: Midcoast squads qualify for pitch playoffs
thread.title_full: Top 10: Midcoast squads qualify for pitch playoffs

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Mark Haskell)
title: Top 10: Midcoast squads qualify for pitch playoffs
text:
High school boys and girls soccer Top 10: Midcoast squads qualify for pitch playoffs Oceanside, Camden Hills, Searsport, Medomak Valley, Mount View, islands advance By Mark Haskell | Oct 21, 2015 
Augusta — The regular season officially has come and gone for Midcoast high school boys and girls soccer teams. 
Now, 10 squads from from Knox, Waldo and part of Lincoln counties will begin their respective journeys into the playoffs — and hopefully, toward the all-important, coveted state championships. 
The Oceanside, Camden Hills, Searsport and Vinalhaven/North Haven boys and girls squads have qualified for postseason play, as have the Mount View girls and Medomak Valley boys. 
The Belfast boys and girls, along with the Medomak Valley girls and Mount View boys, came up short in their respective postseason bids. 
The following is a breakdown of the final standings and playoff pairings for local squads: 
Boys 
In Class A North, Camden Hills (10-2-2, 127.2449 points) finished third, while Lewiston (14-0, 184.3878 points) finished first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs, thus, the Windjammers are playoff-bound. 
No. 3 Camden Hills will host No. 6 Cony (7-6-1, 61.9388 points) in a quarterfinal playoff on Wednesday, Oct. 28 at 3 p.m. The Windjammers earned a 7-0 win over the Rams Sept. 10 in Augusta. 
In Class B North, Oceanside (10-2-2, 110.9949 points) finished fourth, Medomak Valley (9-3-2, 92.0918 points) eighth, Mount View (4-10, 21.3265 points) 16th and Belfast (1-13, 8.7245 points) 17th. Ellsworth (11-2-1, 163.2398 points) finished first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs, thus, the Mariners and Panthers are playoff-bound, while the Mustangs and Lions failed to qualify. 
No. 4 Oceanside will host the winner of the prelim playoff between No. 5 Waterville (11-2-1, 110.0255 points) and No. 12 Hermon (3-9-2, 60.1276 points) in a quarterfinal game, time and date to be determined. The Mariners fell to the Purple Panthers 1-0 Oct. 1 in Thomaston, while the Mariners and Hawks do not play each other during the regular season. However, the Mariners did earn a 2-1 win over the Hawks in last year's prelim playoff round, which ended in penalty kicks. 
No. 8 Medomak Valley will host No. 9 Foxcroft Academy of Dover-Foxcroft (10-3-1, 89.8980 points) in a prelim playoff on Saturday, Oct. 24 at 3 p.m. The Panthers and Ponies do not play each other during the regular season. The winner will advance to face top-seeded Ellsworth in the quarterfinal round. The Panthers lost to the Eagles 6-2 in last year's semifinal round. 
In Class D South, Searsport (10-3-1, 108.6480 points) finished third and Vinalhaven/North Haven (5-7, 57.0346 points) seventh. Buckfield (13-1, 148.9109 points) finished first in the 14 team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs, thus, both Viking squads are playoff-bound. 
No. 3 Searsport will host No. 6 Greenville (4-6-4, 58.5714 points) in a quarterfinal game, time and date to be determined. The Vikings and Lakers battled to a scoreless, double-overtime tie Sept. 14 in Searsport. 
No. 7 Vinalhaven/North Haven will host No. 10 Valley of Bingham (5-8-1, 25.3352 points) in a prelim playoff game, time and date to be determined. The islanders swept the Cavaliers this season as they earned a 6-5 win Sept. 25 and 6-2 win Sept. 26 at Vinalhaven. The winner will advance to face No. 2 Richmond in a quarterfinal game, time and date to be determined. The Bobcats earned a 9-1 win over the islanders Sept. 11 in Richmond and a 3-1 win Oct. 9 on Vinalhaven. 
Girls 
In Class A North, Camden Hills (13-0-1, 184.8980 points) finished first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs, thus, the Windjammers are playoff-bound. 
The top-seeded Windjammers will face the winner of the prelim playoff game between No. 8 Brewer (8-6, 61.9388 points) and No. 9 Mount Blue of Farmington (7-6-1, 57.3469 points) in a quarterfinal playoff game on Tuesday, Oct. 27 at 3 p.m. The Windjammers earned a 4-0 win over the Witches Sept. 18 in Rockport and 3-2 win over the Cougars Oct. 6 in Farmington. 
In Class B North, Oceanside (12-0-2, 176.9133 points) finished first, Mount View (5-6-3, 69.3112 points) 10th, Medomak Valley (3-10-1, 24.2347 points) 14th and Belfast (2-12, 11.6327 points) 18th in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs, thus, the Mariners and Mustangs are playoff-bound, while the Panthers and Lions failed to qualify. 
The top-seeded Mariners will face the winner of the prelim playoff between No. 8 Caribou (8-6, 92.6020 points) and No. 9 Nokomis of Newport (7-6-1, 70.2806 points) in a quarterfinal game, time and date to be determined. The Mariners do not face the Vikings during the regular season, but beat the Warriors 2-0 Oct. 12 in Thomaston. 
No. 10 Mount View will travel to face No. 7 Erskine Academy (10-3-1, 93.0612 points) in a prelim playoff game, time and date to be determined. The Mustangs and Eagles no not play each other during the regular season. 
In Class D South, Searsport (10-4, 68.4184 points) finished fourth and Vinalhaven/North Haven (7-5, 60.0397 points) fifth. Richmond (13-1, 154.1497 points) finished first in the 10-team region. The top seven teams qualify for the playoffs, thus, both Viking squads are playoff-bound. 
No. 4 Searsport will host No. 5 Vinalhaven/North Haven Tuesday, Oct. 27 at 1 p.m. in a quarterfinal game. The Viking squads do not play each other during the regular season. The winner will advance to face top-seeded Richmond. The Bobcats beat Vinalhaven/North Haven 8-0 Sept. 11 in Richmond and 7-1 Oct. 9 on Vinalhaven, while also earning a pair of 4-0 wins over Searsport — one Sept. 25 in Searsport and the other Oct. 10 in Richmond.
